title: Keeping Chad’s Transition on Track
description: How can the United States and the international community support Chad’s transition to democracy? Mvemba Phezo Dizolele and Anastasia Strouboulis reflect on the past year of junta-led transitional rule and outline steps toward getting democratization right.

title: The Evening: Donbas Attacked, Covid Mandate Thrown Out, Wrecking Ball, and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers Donbas Attacked, Covid Mandate Thrown Out, Wrecking Ball, and More.

title: U.S. Power and Influence in the Middle East: Part Seven
description: Jon concludes the 7-part miniseries by looking at the role that the Middle East should play in U.S. global strategy.

title: Conference Games
description: This week, the Scholl Chair discusses a Congressional rarity—an actual House-Senate conference on legislation, in this case, the competing versions of China legislation.

title: U.S.-India 2+2 Ministerial Dialogue
description: What came out of the recent U.S.-India 2+2 dialogue? Here's a digest of what we heard, and what we can expect for the bilateral relationship.

title: The War in Ukraine: Aftershocks in the Balkans
description: As Russia’s war in Ukraine continues, Europe and the United States must act to deepen stability and security in the Western Balkans.

title: Designing New Battlegroups: Advice for NATO Planners
description: NATO’s response to Russia’s invasion of Ukraine now includes four new battlegroups added to its forward presence in eastern Europe. As NATO military planners develop these new forces, here are five principles that should guide their work.

title: The Russia-Ukraine War and Global Food Security: A Seven-Week Assessment, and the Way Forward for Policymakers
description: Russia’s war in Ukraine presents never-before-seen consequences for global agriculture and food security. Policymakers should consider responses that help food-importing countries withstand today’s supply and price shocks—and future shocks as well.

title: Will Finland and Sweden Join NATO?
description: One consequence of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine may be the exact thing Russian president Vladimir Putin, the war’s architect, did not want: the enlargement of NATO, starting with Finland and Sweden.

title: Dutch Foreign Minister Wopke Hoekstra on Transatlantic Security after Ukraine
description: CSIS hosted a conversation with Wopke Hoekstra, vice prime minister and minister of foreign affairs of the Netherlands, about the war in Ukraine and its implications for transatlantic security cooperation.

title: The Latest on Southeast Asia: April 14, 2022
description: Since postponing the U.S.-ASEAN Special Summit, originally slated for late March, the Biden administration has been working to demonstrate continued commitment to the region.

title: How to Win the Battle in Eastern Ukraine
description: Russian forces are preparing for a large battle in eastern Ukraine to defeat the Ukrainian army and use terrain as a bargaining chip at the negotiating table. Kyiv should transition from a defensive war and conduct localized counterattacks to limit Russia’s advance.
